sentences.sContent: Shall we go out to the cinema or stay at home?
sentences.sCn: 我们是出去看电影还是待在家里？

sentences.sContent: You can have ham, cheese, or tuna.
sentences.sCn: 你可以选择火腿、干酪或者金枪鱼。

sentences.sContent: She wasn’t involved in drugs or anything like that.
sentences.sCn: 她没有涉毒之类的行为。

sentences.sContent: Grapes are usually either green or red.
sentences.sCn: 葡萄一般要么是绿色，要么是红色。

sentences.sContent: He’s going to do it whether we like it or not.
sentences.sCn: 不管我们喜欢与否，他都会去做这件事。

sentences.sContent: You must do the job yourself or else employ someone else to do it.
sentences.sCn: 你必须自己做这件事，或者就雇别人去做。

sentences.sContent: ...And you may even spot the highway or railroad from this point...
...In the wide lands or in dense grass...
...sit down on the log or rock...
...Streams normally flow through wide land before they reach a lake or river though there are more eatable plants...
...Anyone interested or intend to inquire about please do not feel hesitated to contact Xiao Li...
...or will choose to remain in the city center...
...Great leaders recognize the weak signals or slight signs that point to big changes to come...

trans.tranOther: used between two words or phrases to show that either of two things is possible, or used before the last in a list of possibilities or choices
